channel.title: Custom JFrame Client
channel.description: I'm sure this has been posted before but what code would I put in my class to run the client in custom JFrame/JPanel? I need this so I can set the default look and feel. As well as other things.

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:57, topic:10518”]Stop flooding the poor kid’s head with imaginary start() init() bullshit Krichevskoy.

You have to call both init() and start(). I also think you need to initialise the signlink objects.[/quote]

I never called start(), only init(), decompile moparscape if you dont believe me

item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Drunk On Java:

My problem is that start(); and init(); are not loading correctly. I have everything setup correctly too.

You might be redundantly starting the thread. IIRC, init() eventually calls start() on the client Runnable…or am I just making this up?

item.title: Custom JFrame Client
item.dc:creator: @Drunk_On_Java Drunk On Java
item.description:
@Drunk_On_Java wrote:

I am trying what brother NOURLOL is saying now, as for the errors that’s exactly what I was getting.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 22, 2006, 06:57:07 PM[/size][hr]Okay, I am not sure what it is doing but it still is not working right.

/*******************************************************************
 *                        Endar V5 Launcher	                   *
 *******************************************************************/

import java.awt.*;
import javax.swing.*;

/*******************************************************************
 * Copyright 2006 Goat Spirit. All Rights Reserved.                *
 * I, Goat Spirit created this. Some helped with the coding though.*
 *******************************************************************/
 
public class Launcher {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);
	
        	JFrame frame = new JFrame("Endar V5 - By Goat Spirit");
        
        	frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        	frame.setResizable(false);

        	frame.pack();
        	frame.setVisible(true);
        
        	client c = new client();
        
		frame.getContentPane().add(c);
	
		c.init();
		c.start();
	}
}

That’s my class. Everything is as you told me. When it starts up it appears as like a 30x30 square of the closing “X” icon. Then it displays an error in the command prompt about client.class. I have tryed almost everything I can think of.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom JFrame Client
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Drunk On Java, post:24, topic:10518”]Lord I’m stressed! I have spent the last two hours on this. I decompiled mopar 2.1 bot, I kind of under stand it but if I try to compile I get exception; is not a statement. I delete that, I get 50 some errors. I fixed em all down to 2 then it says I can’t extend client. I am using blakescape source. I think somethings in the client that is making it not be able to extend…I swear. God my brain and head hurts. :([/quote]You’re not supposed to decompile it and then recompile it ;|

You’re probably getting L3:_ or whatever, shit of that sort. That’s not a statement, as the compiletime error says.

And exactly what NOURLOL said.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom JFrame Client
item.dc:creator: @Drunk_On_Java Drunk On Java
item.description:
@Drunk_On_Java wrote:

Could you help me, by inserting the correct code? I restarted, heres my code:

/****************************************************************
 *                      Endar V5 Launcher	                *
 ****************************************************************/

import java.awt.*;
import javax.swing.*;

/*******************************************************************
 * Copyright 2006 Goat Spirit. All Rights Reserved.                *
 * I, Goat Spirit created this. Some helped with the coding though.*
 *******************************************************************/
 
public class Launcher extends client {

	private JPanel contentPane;

	public Launcher() {
		super();
		
		initializeComponent();
		
		this.setVisible(true);
	}

	private void initializeComponent() {
		contentPane = (JPanel)this.getContentPane();
		
		contentPane.setLayout(null);
		
		this.setTitle("Endar V5 - By Goat Spirit");
		this.setLocation(new Point(0, 0));
		this.setSize(new Dimension(640, 500));
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);
		
		JDialog.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);
		
		try {
			UIManager.setLookAndFeel("javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalLookAndFeel");
		} catch (Exception ex) {
			System.out.println("Failed loading Look and Feel: ");
			System.out.println(ex);
		}
		new Launcher();
	}
}

You wouldn’t believe how happy I would be.

Read full topic
